If you are looking for an opportunity to contribute your experience, knowledge, and passion in a meaningful way, CLBC is the place for you!

Community Living British Columbia (CLBC) is a Crown corporation responsible for arranging supports and services for adults with developmental disabilities and their families. CLBC staff strive to advance the vision of Communities of belonging, lives with connection.

The Role

As a Senior .Net Developer at CLBC, you will assist with the design and development of new and existing CLBC business systems, as well as provide technical analysis and programming for IT business solutions and for interfaces to other systems used by internal and external clients.

Responsibilities Include

Providing expertise in the development and implementation of CLBC business systems and ensure that development methods are consistent with the technical directions and business strategies determined by the organization
Developing application interfaces for diverse and complex systems, technical templates and user interfaces.
Developing, enhancing and maintaining existing applications and interfaces
Problem-solving to resolve technical and business process problems related to applications (Tier 3 Support)
Works with the Enterprise architect on the design of the overall solution
Constructs design documentation
Recommends integrated solution designs for CLBC business systems integration
Provide Tier 3 support for production-related issues
Following appropriate change management methodologies to ensure that published content is appropriate, accurate, timely, and falls within standards.

Competency Is Required In Most Of The Following

C+, .NET, SSIS, Oracle DB (PL-SQL), SVN, Active Directory, XML, Powershell, IIS, SQL Server DB (T-SQL), Delphi, Sharepoint, CSS, Javascript, HTML, Powerdesigner, Toad, Visual Studio

Qualifications

Bachelor of Science in Computer Science, Information Management or Management Information Systems and 5 years related experience; or a diploma in Information Technology with 10 years related experience; or other relevant equivalent combination of education, experience and training may be considered
Experience in systems analysis, software development and production support
Demonstrated familiarity with all phases of the software development life cycle

Benefits

Employer-paid extended health and dental plan
A BC Public Service Pension plan with employer contributions
Generous vacation plus additional personal days
Paid maternity/parental/adoption leave
Life insurance, paid sick days, and, if needed, long-term disability
Wellness supports, including an Employee and Family Assistance Program
Professional development funds and resources to encourage continuous learning and skill development
Access to government discounts to travel, cell phones, and more!

Additional Info

This position is posted to fill two new vacancies

Term/Status: Regular/Full time

Classification/Salary: Info Systems R27 / Position starts at $80,652 annually, plus a 9.9% bi-weekly market adjustment

The health and safety of our team and communities is paramount to CLBC. Accordingly, we require anyone joining our team to provide proof of full COVID-19 vaccination.

Closing date: Open until filled

Apply now! Submit a resume and cover letter online to the attention of Akshay Shekhawat. Applications received by email or other methods will not be considered.

Successful applicants are subject to a Criminal Record Check (Criminal Records Review Act) and are required to provide a clean Driver's Abstract.

An eligibility list for internal candidates may be established.

Community Living BC is an equal opportunity employer.
